a Turkish unit of weight equal to about 2.75 pounds
the process of becoming softened and saturated as a consequence of being immersed in water (or other liquid)
Acacia koa, a species of large tree in the family Fabaceae which is endemic to and common on the islands of Hawaii; or the wood of this tree.

A style of Jamaican dance music combining elements of Caribbean calypso and mento with American jazz and rhythm and blues.
a very poisonous metallic element that has three allotropic forms
the syllable naming the fifth (dominant) note of any musical scale in solmization
